#summary How to use python-googletranslate in your software project

= Introduction =

This section describes how to use the python-googletranslate class in your project.


= Details =
*Include the library into your project*

{{{import python-googletranslate}}}

== Traditional way ==
*To make a new translation object*

{{{myTranslation = Translation('Text to be translated or detected')}}}


*To detect the language* (returns the language code)

{{{myTranslation.detectLanguage()}}}


*To translate from English to French* (returns the translation)

{{{myTranslation.translate('en','fr')}}}


*Or combine both*, translating from a detected language to French (returns the translation)

{{{myTranslation.translate('fr')}}}

== Quick way (version >= 0.2) ==
*To detect the language* (returns the language code)

{{{Translation.dctDetectLanguage('Text to be detected')}}}

*To translate from English to French* (returns the translation)

{{{Translation.dctTranslate('Text to be translated','en','fr')}}}

*Or combine both*, translating from a detected language to French (returns the translation)

{{{myTranslation.translate('Text to be translated','fr')}}}

----

For a complete list of the language codes see http://code.google.com/apis/language/translate/v2/using_rest.html#language-params

`ValueError` exception is raised when one of the parameters is wrong

`IOError` exception is raised when the connection to Google could not be made
